capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly the boy who lived, and it's amazing to think about all he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you imagine being famous in the wizarding world from birth just because of a lightning-shaped scar on your forehead? It's incredible how much pressure that must have put on him, but he always managed to rise above it.

You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's often referred to as "the boy who lived" because of his incredible luck in surviving all those attempts on his life as a child. It's really quite remarkable when you think about it. I mean, can you imagine being in his shoes?

I mean, can you imagine being in his shoes? Constantly looking over your shoulder, never knowing when the next danger would strike. It's no wonder he grew up with such a strong sense of determination and courage.
